channel.title: I need server help
channel.description: :| Okay, -I have port forwarded -I have MY client's IP set as 127.0.0.1 (Local) -I have changed it to my no-ip IP when i sent to a friend. -(Not sure if i use the IP from the no-ip or "Belowzero.no-ip.biz) -In the source my "~Run~.bat file has my no-ip IP in it.. -However, I AM able to connect. The problem i'm having is that when people get my client (Folder and all) (No source obviously) There's a command prompt that opens then closes immediately after. And the client doesn't open. I feel as if i could get their client's to work, they'd be able to connect. Here's a picture of the command prompt that opens and immediately closes after. (Hard to take a picture of X_X) http://gyazo.com/8a882d40e667f89f5b191c02a27df163

item.title: I need server help
item.dc:creator: @Bittererglitchz Bittererglitchz
item.description:
@Bittererglitchz wrote:

Okay,
-I have port forwarded
-I have MY client’s IP set as 127.0.0.1 (Local)
-I have changed it to my no-ip IP when i sent to a friend.
-(Not sure if i use the IP from the no-ip or "Belowzero.no-ip.biz)
-In the source my "~Run~.bat file has my no-ip IP in it…
-However, I AM able to connect. The problem i’m having is that when people get my client (Folder and all) (No source obviously) There’s a command prompt that opens then closes immediately after. And the client doesn’t open. I feel as if i could get their client’s to work, they’d be able to connect. Here’s a picture of the command prompt that opens and immediately closes after. (Hard to take a picture of X_X)

Gyazo

Gyazo
